article.title: Steven Universe: Save the Light
article.text:

Finite Reflection Studios (Microsoft Windows) | publisher = [[Cartoon Network Games]] (digital)
Outright Games (physical) | series = | engine = | platforms = {{Unbulleted list|[[PlayStation 4]]|[[Xbox One]]|[[Microsoft Windows]]|[[OS X]]|[[Nintendo Switch]]}} | released = '''PlayStation 4'''{{video game release|WW|October 31, 2017}}'''Xbox One'''{{video game release|WW|November 3, 2017}}'''Microsoft Windows'''{{video game release|WW|August 13, 2018}}'''OS X'''{{video game release|WW|August 13, 2018}}'''Nintendo Switch'''{{video game release|NA|October 30, 2018|EU|November 3, 2018}} | genre = [[Action-adventure]], [[role-playing video game|role-playing]] | modes = | cabinet = | display = | arcade system = | cpu = | sound = | director = Chris Graham https://grumpyfaceblog.tumblr.com/post/166333148928/whos-the-lovely-person-managing-this-blog-and#notes | producer = | designer = | programmer = | artist = | writer = [[Rebecca Sugar]] | composer = | italic title = | alt = }} '''''Steven Universe: Save the Light''''' is an [[action-adventure]] [[role-playing video game]] developed by [[Grumpyface Studios]] and published by [[Cartoon Network Games]]. Based on the television series ''[[Steven Universe]]'', it is a sequel to the 2015 mobile game ''[[Steven Universe: Attack the Light]]''. It was released digitally on October 31, 2017 for [[PlayStation 4]], and on November 3, 2017 for [[Xbox One]],{{cite news|last1=Summers|first1=Nick|title=A new 'Steven Universe' RPG is headed to consoles|url=https://www.engadget.com/2017/03/10/steven-universe-save-the-light-console-rpg/|accessdate=11 March 2017|work=[[Engadget]]|date=10 March 2017}} and was released on Windows and OS X in August 2018, and released on [[Nintendo Switch]] in October 2018.{{Cite web|url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/821890/Steven_Universe_Save_the_Light/|title=Steven Universe: Save the Light on Steam|website=store.steampowered.com|language=en|access-date=2018-07-30}} ==Gameplay== After the events of ''Attack the Light!'', Steven, the Gems and their friends go on a quest to retrieve the Light Prism when the Homeworld Gem Hessonite (voiced by [[Christine Baranski]]) steals it. http://www.psnation.com/2017/06/19/e3-2017-hands-on-with-steven-universe-save-the-light/ ''Save the Light'' features seven playable [[List of Steven Universe characters|characters from the series]], [[Steven Universe (character)|Steven]], [[Garnet (Steven Universe)|Garnet]], [[Amethyst (Steven Universe)|Amethyst]], [[Pearl (Steven Universe)|Pearl]], Connie, Greg and Peridot, with an eighth character to be added in a future content update; four characters can be equipped to a party at a time.{{cite web|title=Steven Universe: Save the Light Gameplay Reveal - PAX East 2017|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ih_lEX3jFW0|publisher=[[IGN]]|accessdate=11 March 2017|date=11 March 2017}} https://grumpyfaceblog.tumblr.com/post/166333266113/will-you-guys-continue-to-update-and-add-more#notes The game has a "blend of real-time and turn-based combat", and more of a focus on exploration and puzzle-solving than its predecessor. Players are able to explore Beach City and surrounding areas, and engage in battles with enemies. During battle, the players' actions, which include attacking and defending, will build up the star meter, which allows the characters to pull off more powerful moves. A new feature allows characters to build up a relationship-based meter during battles and dialogue interactions; when filled, certain characters are able to fuse, such as Steven and Connie into [[Stevonnie]].http://www.gameonohio.com/e3-2017-hands-on-impressions-with-cartoon-networks-steven-universe-and-ok-k-o-games/ ==Development== Grumpyface Studios collaborated on the story with series creator [[Rebecca Sugar]], and cited the increased gameplay complexity compared to ''Attack the Light!'' as a reason for the switch to consoles. The game was announced at [[PAX East]] in March 2017.{{cite news|last1=Fahey|first1=Mike|title=Steven Universe RPG Coming To Consoles This Summer|url=http://kotaku.com/steven-universe-rpg-coming-to-consoles-this-summer-1793111666|accessdate=11 March 2017|work=[[Kotaku]]}} A port of the game to PC and Mac, by Finite Reflection Studios, was announced in July 2018,{{cite web |last1=Grumpyface Studios |title=#StevenUniverse #SaveTheLight is coming to PC & Mac on #Steam! |url=https://twitter.com/Grumpyface/status/1022632301555904513 |publisher=Twitter |accessdate=28 July 2018}} and confirmed to release on [[Steam (software)|Steam]] in August 2018.{{Cite news|url=https://twitter.com/Grumpyface/status/1022632301555904513|title=Grumpyface Studios on Twitter|work=Twitter|access-date=2018-07-30|language=en}} The developers later teased another big announcement related to the game, eventually revealed to be a Nintendo Switch port, and a physical release of the game bundled with [[Capybara Games]]' ''[[OK K.O.! Let's Play Heroes]]'' for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Switch is scheduled for release in May 2019.https://www.polygon.com/2018/8/3/17648148/steven-universe-ok-ko-game-nintendo-switch-release-date ==Reception== Upon release, ''Save the Light'' received mixed reviews. [[Polygon (website)|Polygon]] and [[Destructoid]] both praised the game's art direction, battle system, and connection to the series, but criticized the amount of bugs and glitches found at launch.https://www.destructoid.com/review-steven-universe-save-the-light-469673.phtmlhttps://www.polygon.com/2017/10/31/16581842/steven-universe-save-the-light-review ==References== {{reflist}} {{Steven Universe}} {{Cartoon Network video games}} [[Category:2017 video games]] [[Category:Mac OS games]] [[Category:Nintendo Switch games]] [[Category:PlayStation 4 games]] [[Category:PlayStation Network games]] [[Category:Tactical role-playing video games]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Xbox One games]] [[Category:Video games based on Steven Universe]]
